_prev_prog_3.Description: Vie-Del Company - Fresno has prepared a unified Risk & Process Safety Management Program. The program is in compliance with California's Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program (in California CCR Title 19, Chapter 4.5 Program Level 3 Elements. At the Federal level, Title 40 CFR Part 68), and California OSHA's "Process Safety Management (PSM) of Acutely Hazardous Materials" standard (in California CCR Title 8, Section 5189, "Process Safety Management of Acutely Hazardous Materials," and Federally Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119). This program has been prepared to address the risks involved with the presence of anhydrous ammonia in an amount in excess of 10,000 lbs., which is contained in our refrigeration system.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Executive Summary



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:

- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Vie-Del Company Fresno has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1 Vie-Del Company Fresno, Risk and Process Safety Management Program



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Vie-Del Company Fresno has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name          | Process Chemical          | Process Quantity(lbs.)

North System            Anhydrous Ammonia           20,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. 



Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses and physical property damage.



Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 

1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalAR

P and RMP obligations as well

2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices

3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.



1.2 Process Descriptions

Vie-Del Company Fresno is a processor of fruit juice, concentrate, wine and spirits. Normal operations are Monday through Friday, and can vary from 9 to 24 hours per day.The exception is the grape crushing season that typically lasts from August through November of each year. Stone fruit processing typically lasts from May through August.



Process 1: North System



Two (2) Reciprocating Compressors

One (1) Screw Compressor

Three (3) Evaporative Condensers

Two (2) High Pressure Receivers

Two (2) Shell-In-Tube Heat Exchangers

One (2) Vertical Accumulators (Ice Chillers)

One (1) Horizontal Accumulator (P&F)

Two (2) B.A.C. Ice Chillers

One (1) Plate and Frame Heat Exchanger

One (1) Liquid Transfer Unit

One (1) Main Suction Accumulator

Two (2) Oil Pots

One (1) Diffusion Tank



The refrigeration system is in place to cool products, cool glycol, and create chilled water during processing operations.



The ammonia refrigeration system utilize flooded refrigeration design and operates as follows: high pressure liquid from the high pressure receiver is piped to each heat exchanger where it passes through an expansion valve into a low pressure accumulator or directly into the heat exchanger. Low temperature liquid circulates by thermal convection through the heat exchanger.  Low pressure and temperature gas collects in the accumulator (or shell of the heat exchanger), and passes through a pressure regulator into a suction line. The suction line returns the vapor to the main suction accumulator where residual liquid can be separated from the vapor. From there the

low pressure vapor is piped to the compressors which elevate the temperature and pressure of the gas.  The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure vapor ammonia is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receivers.

 

The ammonia systems at Vie-Del Company Fresno consists of vessels, valves, equipment which are interconnected by piping to form a closed-loop. 



1.4 Five Year Accident History



Vie-Del Company Fresno has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan



Vie-Del Company Fresno's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

- California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

- Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Vie-Del Company Fresno has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Vie-Del Company Fresno continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Vie-Del Company Fresno's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Vie-Del Company Fresno's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Vie-Del Company Fresno has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP

-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Vie-Del Company Fresno has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.



For the future, Vie-Del Company Fresno now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Vie-Del Company Fresno employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Vie-Del Company Fresno will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
